p: The reactions were carried out in a jacketed cylindrical glass reactor (6 mm high × 4 mm internal diameter and 50 mL capacity, coupled with a reflux condenser) containing 15 g of substrate consisting of Jatropha oil to ethanol at molar ratio of 1 : 9 in a solvent-free system. The mixtures were incubated with the prepared biocatalysts at fixed proportion of 500 IU per gram of oil under agitation (200 rpm) at 45°C for a maximum period of 72 h. The reaction progress was monitored by taking samples at various time intervals and the ethyl esters formed were analyzed using a gas chromatography (Varian CG 3800, Inc., Palo Alto, CA, USA) with FID detection and a 5% DEGS CHR-WHP 80/100 mesh 6 ft 2.0 mm ID and 1/800 OD column (Restek Frankel Commerce of Analytic Instruments Ltd., SP, Brazil) following previous established conditions [21, 34].
